title: Tumat Sogolik
text:
Tumat Sogolik (born 5 May 1955) is a Papua New Guinean <a href="boxing">boxer</a>. He represented his country in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%201976%20Summer%20Olympics">bantamweight</a> division at the <a href="1976%20Summer%20Olympics">1976 Summer Olympics</a>. He won his first match over <a href="Samuel%20Meck">Samuel Meck</a>. He lost his second match against <a href="Chul%20Soon-Hwang">Chul Soon-Hwang</a>.
He later competed in boxing in the <a href="1978%20Commonwealth%20Games">1978 Commonwealth Games</a> in <a href="Edmonton">Edmonton</a>, Canada. He won silver in the Bantamweight division after losing to <a href="Barry%20McGuigan">Barry McGuigan</a> of Northern Ireland. Tumat presently lives on Tsoi Island in the <a href="New%20Ireland%20Province">New Ireland Province</a> of <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea">Papua New Guinea</a>.
